intro: Cystodium sorbifolium, commonly known as the common cystodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of sorrel, giving it its species name *sorbifolium*. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland and grassland habitats. Cystodium sorbifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
